summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons Special Housing Unit (SHU) Weekly Review report from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, dated August 8, 2019. It documents the status of inmate Jeffrey Edward Epstein, including details of a July 23, 2019 incident where he was found with a homemade rope around his neck, classified as a suicide attempt and pending a disciplinary hearing.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the prison report, listed as inmate 76318-054, pending a disciplinary hearing for a self-mutilation/suicide attempt on July 23, 2019.

persons.name: M. Rice
persons.context: Listed as the admitting officer on the prison administrative form for inmate Epstein.

persons.name: Tana째hone Mchotasit
persons.context: Identified as Epstein's cellmate (inmate number 79514-054) in the report of the July 23, 2019 incident.

connections.description: Were housed together as cellmates at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, as noted in the report of the July 23 incident.

events.title: Epstein Suicide Attempt in MCC
events.description: Inmate Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell with a homemade rope around his neck. The incident is classified as a suicide attempt and self-mutilation (Code 228).

events.title: SHU Weekly Review and Pending DHO
events.description: A Bureau of Prisons administrative report documents Epstein's status in the Special Housing Unit, noting a pending Disciplinary Hearing Officer (DHO) proceeding for the July 23 incident.

keyFacts: The document is a Bureau of Prisons administrative report dated August 8, 2019, detailing inmate Jeffrey Epstein's status.
It records a July 23, 2019 incident where Epstein was found with a homemade rope around his neck, classified as a suicide attempt/self-mutilation.
Epstein was pending a Disciplinary Hearing Officer (DHO) hearing for this Code 228 violation at the time of the report.
Epstein's cellmate is identified as Tana째hone Mchotasit (inmate 79514-054).
The report is part of a Threat Assessment case (NYM-19.0061) following the incident.
